results.title: ‘Top Gun: Maverick’ Review: Will This Stuff Still Fly?
results.abstract: Tom Cruise takes to the air once more in a long-awaited sequel to a much-loved ’80s action blockbuster.

multimedia.caption: Tom Cruise returns as the hotshot pilot Pete Mitchell in the sequel “Top Gun: Maverick.”

results.title: In Cannes, Filmmakers Contend With Despair and Beauty, Too
results.abstract: Titles like “Aftersun,” “Tori and Lokita” and “EO” offer dark visions that challenge and move viewers.

results.title: Which Cannes Films Have the Best Oscar Odds?
results.abstract: Movies from Park Chan-wook, Lukas Dhont and Hirokazu Kore-eda could be what academy voters are looking for. But don’t count out “Top Gun: Maverick.”

results.title: Ray Liotta, of ‘Goodfellas’ and ‘Field of Dreams,’ Dies at 67
results.abstract: He was known for his intensity, especially in crime dramas, but he was also adept at comedy. “You want to do as many different genres as you can,” he once said.

multimedia.caption: Ray Liotta in the 2005 film "Revolver," directed by Guy Ritchie.
Ray Liotta in the 2005 film "Revolver," directed by Guy Ritchie.

results.title: ‘Vengeance Is Mine’ Review: A Tangled Web of Human Impulse
results.abstract: This engrossing, tangled film by Michael Roemer, originally called “Haunted” and released in 1984, finally gets the proper theatrical release it deserves.

results.title: The Dangerous Challenge of Making a Film About Aleksei Navalny
results.abstract: A documentarian was in the room when the Russian opposition leader made a startling discovery. But it took time to win the politician’s trust.

results.title: James Wong Howe: A Gutsy Cinematographer Finally Gets His Due
results.abstract: A retrospective at the Museum of the Moving Image looks at a career filled with sublime images made at a time of strong anti-Asian sentiment in Hollywood.

results.title: Kevin Spacey Facing Sexual Assault Charges in Britain
results.abstract: British prosecutors said that they had authorized criminal charges against Mr. Spacey, 62, for four counts of sexual assault. He cannot be formally charged unless he enters England or Wales.
results.byline: By Alex Marshall and Julia Jacobs

results.title: Film on Expulsion of Kashmir’s Hindus Is Polarizing and Popular in India
results.abstract: Called propaganda by critics and essential viewing by fans, “The Kashmir Files,” an unexpected blockbuster, has drawn the support of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s Bharatiya Janata Party.

multimedia.caption: An advertisement for the “The Kashmir Files” outside a theater in the old quarters of Delhi in March.

results.title: Jurnee Smollett: ‘The Past Few Years Have Been Heartbreaking’
results.abstract: The “Lovecraft Country” star has faced setbacks but emerged with new projects, including the Netflix movie “Spiderhead.”

multimedia.caption: Jurnee Smollett’s career has included film (“Birds of Prey,” “Eve’s Bayou”), TV (“Lovecraft Country,” “Friday Night Lights”) and theater (“The Trip to Bountiful”). “I’m trying to find a balance between enjoying the now, because that’s something I struggle with, and always looking to the future,” she said.
multimedia.copyright: Akilah Townsend for The New York Times

results.title: The All-Female Band Fanny Made History. A New Doc Illuminates It.
results.abstract: The group put out five albums in the ’70s and counted David Bowie and Bonnie Raitt as fans. The filmmaker Bobbi Jo Hart, dismayed its story hadn’t been told, took action.
